Peripheral artery disease (PAD)_1: Patient A, a 62-year-old male, presented with a complex array of symptoms. He reported consistent leg pain (claudication) rated 8/10 in severity, localized in the calves, which significantly hinders his ability to walk or engage in physical activities. Additionally, he experiences muscle pain and cramping in his legs during exercise, which subsides with rest. Notably, the patient has a history of smoking and is diagnosed with diabetes. Physical examination revealed a weak pulse in his lower extremities, coldness in the lower leg, and slower growth of toenails. These findings, along with the presence of risk factors, underscore the need for a comprehensive diagnostic evaluation to ascertain the underlying cause of his symptoms and their impact on his daily life.
Peripheral artery disease (PAD)_2: Patient B, a 68-year-old female, presented with a multifaceted constellation of symptoms. She described bilateral leg pain during walking, with a pain score of 7/10, and experienced muscle pain and cramping in her legs, which were alleviated by rest. Despite no history of smoking, she has a family background of peripheral artery disease, heart disease, and stroke. Examination revealed lower leg numbness, shiny skin, and skin color changes on her legs. These findings, coupled with her family history, necessitate a thorough diagnostic assessment to determine the etiology of her symptoms and their impact on her daily activities.
Peripheral artery disease (PAD)_3: Patient C, a 70-year-old male, reported a spectrum of distressing symptoms. He described excruciating leg pain (rated 9/10) when walking, which significantly limits his mobility. Moreover, he experiences painful cramping in his hips, thighs, and calves after activities. The patient has a long history of smoking and is diagnosed with obesity, high blood pressure, and high cholesterol. Physical examination revealed no pulse in his legs, as well as sores on his feet that have been slow to heal. These findings, in the context of his extensive risk factors, underscore the urgency of a comprehensive diagnostic workup to elucidate the underlying cause of his symptoms and their impact on his daily life.
